title: Croatian Conservative Party
text:
The Croatian Conservative Party ( or HKS) was a <a href="conservatism">conservative</a> political party in <a href="Croatia">Croatia</a>. Last president of the party was <a href="Marijan%20Pavli%C4%8Dek">Marijan Pavliček</a>. It was founded on 20 November 2014.
It joined the <a href="Alliance%20of%20Conservatives%20and%20Reformists%20in%20Europe">Alliance of European Conservatives and Reformists</a> (now Alliance of Conservatives and Reformists in Europe) in May 2015. Its sole MEP has been a member of the <a href="European%20Conservatives%20and%20Reformists">European Conservatives and Reformists</a> since the party's foundation.
On October 2, 2021, a unification assembly was held in Croatia's capital <a href="Zagreb">Zagreb</a>. During the assembly it was announced, that three smaller <a href="conservative">conservative</a> and <a href="right-wing">right-wing</a> parties (Croatian Conservative Party, <a href="Croatian%20Growth">Hrast-Movement for Successful Croatia</a> and the <a href="Generation%20of%20Renewal">Generation of Renewal</a>) will become <a href="wiktionary%3Adefunct">defunct</a> to merge and work together as the Croatian Sovereignists.
